title: LOW FPS with high-end graphics card
body:
Hello. Recently my PC have decided that I should not play League on good frames anymore. I have a high end gaming laptop with a Nvidia GTX 980 graphics card. 
Today I was trying to play League, got into a game and only got 37 FPS, on low settings or high, doesnt matter. 37. Tried my on board intel graphics card, which is shit and got around 60fps. 
Funny thing is, right after I turn on/off anti aliasing or vertical sync, or change the FPS limiter in the setting, i get max FPS, around 350ish for around 5 seconds, before going back to, you guessed it, 37. I dont have any issues with my other games like H1Z1 or Overwatch, which I run on ultra setting and getting good FPS.  Tried reinstalling league and my graphics drivers, with no luck. 
Current mood: 750/750 {{item:3070}} 

Anyone know a fix?

replies.body:
Ooof, I'm pretty jealous of that beefy video card. I'm still rocking a GTX 680 in my rig. {{item:3070}} 

Right, let's get down to business (to defeat the huns)!

___

There are a few things that could be causing your low and erratic FPS. First, if you're running Windows 10, be sure you've [disabled the Windows Game Bar](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html). The *Game DVR* feature inside the game bar has been causing FPS issues and crashes for some players, so it's a quick step to check if this was your issue.

If that didn't resolve your issue, I'd recommend working through the rest of the steps inside our [FPS troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) that you haven't touched on, as they commonly resolve these issue. Should you still encounter issues with your FPS after trying all of this, please let me know.

Hi guys, I have the same problem and I tried the trouble shouting guide and nothing worked. I played two time when I buy my laptop and it was running perfectly but since I updated LOL I get fps around 19 - 30. I have a GTX 1070 and i don't know what to do.
The gaming center of my ASUS ROG is telling me that my memory from my GPU is overloaded and it runs at 4007 MHz . I'm not an expert in this so I'm asking you guys.

Thanks

I got it working, I created a new profile with the maximum performance setting, It didnt change a thing, but I combined it with turning off the anti aliasing FXAA option, which got my FPS back up again around 300. Thanks for the help guys! :-D 
Now Im gonna go ruin someones day by playing Teemo and laughing the entire laning phase.

Hey im not from rito but,

try this solution if you didnt fix your problem already:

Open your nvidia control panel head over to 3D Settings and create a profile for 
[Riot Games Folder] \League of Legends\RADS\solutions\lol_game_client_sln\releases\ [version number] \deploy\League of Legends.exe
Change the Power management mode to "prefer maximum performance" and apply
